title: Phaidon Area book type.
content:
Hi all, i want to identify the typeface used in Phaidon's Area book. Here's a sample i got from the website.  
 [http://www.phaidon.com/area/](http://web.archive.org/web/20120730104151/http:/www.phaidon.com/area/ "http://www.phaidon.com/area/")

Thanks in advace for the feedback.

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [area.png](http://web.archive.org/web/20120730104151/http:/typophile.com/files/area.png) | 61.58 KB |
author: arena

comments.content: I was convinced this had [Lineto](http://web.archive.org/web/20120730104151/http:/www.lineto.com/) written all over it, but no...

I have only seen this in Phaidon's books. Maybe their proprietary font. It shares some characteristics with the rounded [DIN 17](http://web.archive.org/web/20120730104151/http:/www.fontshop.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=catalog.fontdetail&displayfontid=SG.9416.0.0&attributes.sampleSize=48&sampleText=contemporary&sampleSize=48) and Lineto's [Typ1451](http://web.archive.org/web/20120730104151/http:/www.lineto.com/The+Fonts/Categories/Text+Fonts/Typ1451/Regular/) based on lettering templates.
